text.p: The following are top headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Junior hockey demands answers: Lawyer will report on what ails sport and how to fix it in wake of sex-abuse scandal.
- Daredevils should pay for rescue, study says: Little thought for risks to others.
- Clinton envisions a new land: President's inaugural speech calls on Americans to "unleash limitless potential"
- Maurice Strong to lead reshaping of UN: Leaner executive branch predicted.
- Judicial selections raise fear of white, male domination: Ontario moving back to old days, committee sources say.
- Ski-Doos latest trendy toy in Russia: Montreal firm cashing in on impulsive shopping habits of people who have suddenly found themselves with money to burn.
- Banks urged to split top jobs: Big pension funds back plan to force Royal, National to divide CEO, chairman roles.
- More oil patch mergers loom after record year: Strong oil, gas prices fuel new round of deals in the works.
- Manitoba stock grab probed: Regulators check reports extra phone firm receipts bought.
- Deadline set for Busang deal: Settle terms or lose stake, Barrick told.
- High noon for Bre-X, Barrick: Indonesia tells the gold miners to settle local demands for more of the giant Busang find within a month or risk having it taken from them.
- Biotech firms suffer in tough AIDS drug market.
